column4: So if I'm an idiot and remove the 'root' entry from my /etc/passwd to try and reset it, is there a way undo the damage from a user account? (sudo = "sudo: no passwd entry for root!") If not, I'll just use a LiveCD.
reboot to the recovery console (at GRUB)
Slart: Yes, I know. My question was if there was a way to do it from a user account (so I don't have to reboot).
Not if you can't sudo, no.
